Sentencas: Improving proton conduction in cathodes is regarded as one of the most effective methods to accelerate the sluggish proton-involved oxygen reduction reaction (P-ORR) for proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells (P-SOFCs).
Titulo: Theoretical and Experimental Investigations on K-doped SrCo0.9Nb0.1O3-δ as a Promising Cathode for Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In this work, K+ dopant was used to improve the proton uptake and migration ability of SrCo0.9Nb0.1O3-delta (SCN).
Titulo: Theoretical and Experimental Investigations on K-doped SrCo0.9Nb0.1O3-δ as a Promising Cathode for Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: K+-doped SCN (KSCN) demonstrated great potential to be a promising cathode for P-SOFCs.
Titulo: Theoretical and Experimental Investigations on K-doped SrCo0.9Nb0.1O3-δ as a Promising Cathode for Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Density functional theory calculations suggested that doping with K+ led to more oxygen vacancies and more negative values of hydration enthalpy, which was helpful for the improvement of proton concentration.
Titulo: Theoretical and Experimental Investigations on K-doped SrCo0.9Nb0.1O3-δ as a Promising Cathode for Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Importantly, the proton migration barriers could be depressed, benefiting proton conduction.
Titulo: Theoretical and Experimental Investigations on K-doped SrCo0.9Nb0.1O3-δ as a Promising Cathode for Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Electrochemical investigations signified that the cell using KSCN cathode had a peak power density of 967 mW cm(-2) at 700 degrees C, about 54.1 % higher than that using a SCN cathode.
Titulo: Theoretical and Experimental Investigations on K-doped SrCo0.9Nb0.1O3-δ as a Promising Cathode for Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: This research highlights the K+-doping strategy to improve electrochemical performance of cathodes for P-SOFCs.
Titulo: Theoretical and Experimental Investigations on K-doped SrCo0.9Nb0.1O3-δ as a Promising Cathode for Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
